job_description:
CrazyLabs is a top 5 mobile games publisher with over 6 Billion downloads to date, a worldwide leader in hyper-casual games development, distribution, and innovation.

We’re looking for an experienced Game Data Analyst to work closely with the product teams to analyze performance metrics, create insights, and guide data-driven decisions.

If you have Passion for Gaming and work in a dynamic fast fast-paced environment, then this position is for you!

Here’s what we need, up for the challenge?

Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of players to address strategic and operational business questionsOptimization and maximization users monetizationRecommendations for segmented offers based on user segments and behaviorData mining, pattern recognition & correlation analysis and insight generationDefinition, measurement and evaluation of AB test Provide actionable recommendations from game data to shape features, game economy, and future product roadmapsBe involved in building automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide understanding of business KPIs and player experienceIdentify and communicate key trends and potential development improvementsCollaborate with stakeholders to drive insights that will help produce monetization and retention improvementsRecommendations based statistical analysis of data

Requirements:

What we're looking for:

2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in a gaming company -A MUSTBA/B.Sc. in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or another quantitative fieldA methodological approach for data with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisionsExcellent mathematical and analytical skillsExcel/Google spreadsheet skillsProficient with SQL Experience with Tableau or similar analytical toolsAbility to query data in order to evaluate ongoing player behavior and interests in relation to game featuresAbility to effectively communicate data results and related conclusionsTeam-player with excellent initiative and motivationGreat organizational and problem-solving skills

What we offer:

Join an experienced, supportive, and creative team of professionalsMake an impact - shape our next hit mobile games, reaching millions of people worldwide! Personal growth - we encourage continuous learning and development within our international teams
title: Game Data Analyst

job_description:
Almedia helps companies grow by promoting their apps, games, surveys, and more to our big user base of 750k monthly active users. Our main site gets 15k signups a day and 10M page visits per month. In just over 2 years we've paid out almost over $30M to our users, who receive rewards for completing tasks and surveys.

Responsibilities: 

Utilize data to drive revenue maximization in one of the following areas: Advertiser ROAS, User Acquisition, Gamification/ProductLead and take ownership of analytics projects from start to finish, including conducting in-depth analysis of the product funnel, designing and implementing experiments, and creating and implementing decision modelsOwn and execute product experiments aimed at driving growth, enhancing existing features, and identifying new areas of opportunityMeasure the impact of features and projects by analyzing relevant metrics and conducting split-testing in different user cohortsWrite SQL queries to provide key contextual insights for various areas of the businessCollaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product, developers, business development, and user acquisition channel managersDevelop and define meaningful metrics that can be used to measure the progress of teams and projects

Requirements

3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar position, with a track record of contributing to decision-making in business, marketing, or product domainsBachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, or other quantitative fields of studyStrong knowledge of SQL and experience working with relational databases Strong Python skillsPreference for candidates with backgrounds in ad tech, gaming, or marketingDemonstrated ability to conduct in-depth data analysis and derive actionable insightsProficiency in designing and executing experiments, and analyzing the resultsExcellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise mannerStrong problem-solving abilities and a detail-oriented mindsetDemonstrated ability to work independently and lead projects from start to finishExperience collaborating with cross-functional teams and managing multiple stakeholders

Benefits

Small, young, and highly ambitious team - you can shape and contribute to building our futureWell-connected, modern office in Berlin Mitte with weekly eventsFree beverages and snacks3-4 team events/trips outside of Germany per yearCompetitive salaryProfitable start-up - no financial riskBring your own device or choose a new device provided by the companyFlexible working hoursEducation budget
title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence

job_description:
Für unsere Business Intelligence suchen wir in Grasleben, Berlin oder remote eine:n (Junior) Data Analyst:in in Vollzeit

Wir bieten

Eine intensive Einarbeitung zum Kennenlernen der verschiedenen UnternehmensprozesseEinen spannenden Tätigkeitsbereich mit hohem GestaltungsspielraumViele Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Inhouse-VeranstaltungenEin dynamisches Team, in dem eigenständiges Arbeiten gefördert wirdModerne, flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege13. Monatsgehalt garantiert und Chance auf ein 14. Gehalt30 Tage Urlaub im JahrMöglichkeiten zur mobilen ArbeitGleitzeit… und jede Menge weiterer Benefits

Deine Aufgaben

Du unterstützt und berätst unsere Fachbereiche bei komplexen Auswertungen und Analysen ihrer KennzahlenDu erstellst ad hoc Auswertungen und Analysen zu unserem Geschäftsbetrieb und stellst diese dem Team und der Geschäftsleitung bereitGemeinsam mit deinem Team selektierst du unsere Daten für die weitere VerwendungDank deiner Arbeit im Datenmanagement mit der kontinuierlichen Aufbereitung und Visualisierungen unserer Daten, schaffst du die Grundlagen für wichtige UnternehmensentscheidungenDu erarbeitest gemeinsam mit unseren Fachbereichen ihre Anforderungen an Auswertungen und das BerichtswesenDu arbeitest eng mit anderen Teams zusammen, um datenbasierte Lösungen zu entwickeln und umzusetzenDank deiner Arbeit im Datenmanagement und der kontinuierlichen Abstimmung mit den Fachbereichen schaffst du die Basis für wichtige Unternehmensentscheidungen

Das bringst du mit

Du hast dein Studium (gern mit Schwerpunkten im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, o.Ä. ) oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossenErste Berufserfahrung ist von Vorteil aber kein MussDu bist bereits Profi im Umgang mit MS Power BI oder hast Lust eine:r zu werdenIm Umgang mit SQL-Datenbanken bist du geübtIn deiner Laufbahn hast du bereits Erfahrungen in der Datenanalyse- und Aufbereitung gemachtEs macht dir Spaß, Daten und Zahlen zu verstehen, zu hinterfragen und zu analysieren Du zeigst Eigeninitiative und hast eine sorgfältige, strukturierte ArbeitsweiseDein agiles Mindset ermöglicht es dir mit Veränderungen situativ und konstruktiv umzugehen

Interessiert?

Dann bewirb dich jetzt! Wir freuen uns darauf mehr von dir zu erfahren und dir Sport-Thieme vorzustellen.

Sport-Thieme

Sport-Thieme ist der Marktführer im Versandhandel von Sportgeräten für den Schul- und Vereinssport sowie den Fitness- und Therapiebereich in Deutschland und Europa. Wir sind ein innovatives und expandierendes Familienunternehmen mit mehr als 420 Mitarbeiter:innen. Sport-Thieme agiert europa- und weltweit mit einer Produktpalette von über 19.000 Sportartikeln für mehr als 70 Sportarten.

Mit unserer Arbeit helfen wir unseren Kund:innen, einen kleinen Beitrag zur Lebensqualität vieler Menschen zu leisten, die Gesundheit und Freude durch Bewegung erfahren.
title: (Junior) Data Analyst:in

job_description:
Möchten Sie die nächste Stufe in Ihrer Karriere erreichen? Bei Brunel haben Sie die Möglichkeit, sich bei namhaften Kunden kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln - und das branchenübergreifend. Machen Sie noch heute den entscheidenden Schritt Ihrer Karriere und bewerben Sie sich bei uns als Data Engineer/ Data Analyst.
Ihre Aufgabe
Unterstützung der Fachbereiche durch die Bereitstellung regelmäßiger Reports, Dashboards & Analysen.Eigenständige Erstellung und Weiterentwicklung bestehender Reports sowie Ausarbeitung neuer Datenanalysen.Untersuchung verschiedener Fragestellungen.Analyse von neuen Anforderungen sowie die Umsetzung dieser im Reporting.Aufbereitung und Bereitstellung von Daten für Entscheidungsgrundlagen.
Ihr Profil
 Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation - Selbstständige und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise, analytische Kompetenz und eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit - Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenanalyse sowie Erfahrung mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache (z. B. Python, Scala) - Zahlenaffinität sowie Verständnis von und Interesse an komplexen technischen & betriebswirtschaftlichen Abläufen sowie Zusammenhängen
Wir Bieten
Wir bieten Ihnen eine Unternehmenskultur, die geprägt ist von der Vielfältigkeit unserer Mitarbeiter sowie von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung - zwischen den Mitarbeitern und auf allen Unternehmensebenen. Dazu gehören neben abwechslungsreichen Stammtischen mit den lokalen Brunel Teams, auch regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche über Ihre Herausforderungen und Perspektiven mit Ihrem Account Manager. Mit individuellen Fortbildungen und Trainings werden Sie optimal gefördert und auf zukünftige Projekte vorbereitet. Unbefristete Arbeitsverträge, 30 Tage Urlaub, Arbeitskontenregelung sowie betriebliche, arbeitgeberfinanzierte Altersvorsorge sind bei uns selbstverständlich.
title: Data Engineer/ Data Analyst

job_description:
Your mission

Conception and implementation of Ad-hoc Reports and Business DashboardsTranslate important business questions into concrete analytical tasks and delivering action and optimize measures for all teamsWork together with business partners to develop requirements, define success metrics, manage and execute analytical projects and evaluate resultsDesigning experiments, testing hypotheses and creating models in the areas of customer experience, user acquisition and product, among othersPreparing forecasts and reports, as well as advising the operative business unitsDirect communication with teams to optimize campaigns and events

Your profile

Successfully completed studies in the field of statistics, computer science or economics, social sciences, media or communication sciences, neuroscience, psychology with a focus on statisticsRelevant professional experience in the field of Business IntelligenceVery good knowledge of SQL and R or PythonKnowledge of AB and Multivariate TestingAdditional knowledge of Machine Learning is an advantageExperience with data visualization and reporting software (Tableau, Quicksight, Lookr, Sisense)Strong analytical and conceptual skills and very good general technical understandingGood knowledge and experience in project managementExcellent written and spoken German and English skillsAbove-average quality standards and an absolutely reliable and independent way of workingAbility to work in a team as well as competent and professional appearanceStrong organisational and coordination skillsExperience in the online games industry would be an advantage

Why us?

We offer you a flexible working model. You will work remote or in one of our modern offices in Berlin, Hamburg or Frankfurt Main, which boasts a café, communal rooms & gaming loungeYou will be a member of an experienced, helpful team in a challenging environment with flat hierarchies and leading-edge technologiesWe offer you a wide variety of tasks with a high level of individual responsibility and the opportunity to contribute your strengths and ideas with a great degree of creative freedomWe want to achieve great things with your help and offer you a permanent employment contractVarious benefits such as meal vouchers & sports allowance

Your Tasks
Conceptualize, build and maintain dashboards in Tableau and Google Looker / Looker Studio for Retail Media products (e.g. Sponsored Product Ads)Act as consultant (m/f/d) for the Retail Media product team and support them to accelerate the Retail Media businessConduct deep-dive analysis with actionable recommendations and conclusionsPerform ad-hoc reports and provide insights to Retail Media stakeholders as a basis for decision makingDevelop and implement data-driven use casesSupport and guide junior members of the Analytics team

job_description:
Private equity funds have long been one of the most attractive investment opportunities, outperforming public market benchmarks, like the S&P 500. But these funds have also been difficult or impossible to access, especially for individuals. Onerous paperwork, high investment minimums (~€10m) and difficulty picking a fund have all been hurdles that kept individuals out. Access has always been dominated by institutions or a select few. Enter Moonfare.
Moonfare is revolutionising access to private equity using a fully digital platform that provides qualified investors access to selectively vetted top-performing funds within 15 minutes and at minimums as low as €50,000. Moonfare provides investors with innovative reporting and the potential to trade their stakes in funds using our Secondary Market. We are introducing never before seen transparency and liquidity to private equity, and with our ongoing expansion across key markets in Europe and Asia, we are enabling investors around the world to reach further.
The Moonfare team brings together individuals with a wealth of different backgrounds, from leading investment and private banks and private equity fund managers to disruptive tech startups, leading newspapers and top law firms. Moonfarians strive to keep growing and want to challenge the status quo while working as a team to deliver innovative solutions and the Moonfare vision.
Product Analyst (m/f/d)
The role can be based in Berlin or Lisbon
Moonfare offers our investors a completely digitized platform that enables individuals to invest in a wide range of top-performing funds. As we continue to expand into new geographies and grow our investor base, we are looking for a Product Analyst who can help us use the data we collect to adapt and optimize the way our internal teams operate as well as suggesting new product and process improvements.
You will: 
Leverage your data expertise to develop actionable insights that enhance Moonfares product development processes and decision-making Educate & advise our internal teams on your findings and act as a sparring partner for new ideas Identify gaps in our product and processes and suggest data driven improvements to fill those gaps Work closely with our leadership team to deliver the data resources and drive decision making of the product roadmapIdentify opportunities to build and deploy predictive models to show people the value and importance of data. 
The next Moonfarian:
3+ years of relevant Product Analyst experience Previous experience working with raw data within a data-heavy environmentYou are eager to work with large amounts of data and are skilled at drawing conclusions from that data and can create data pipelines, reports & dashboards as well as complex SQL searchesYou are familiar with statistical and causal methodologiesYou've worked with programming languages such as Python and/or R (would be a plus)You are skilled in using tools and technologies like PostgreSQL, Dremio, Tableau, EstatisticsYou can clearly explain problem statements, hypotheses, insights and suggestions to a diverse group of audiences
If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!
Invest in yourself:
Ownership: All team members are empowered to bring ideas, make decisions and have impact. Participate in our equity program and share in our success. Transparency: Everyone at Moonfare is regularly updated on strategic progress, KPI tracking, product updates and changes. Growth: Not only will you grow in your role, you also have access to an individual growth budget of €1,500 or 2% of base salary (whichever is higher). Diversity: Our Diversity Committee ensures we hold ourselves accountable and continuously improve our D&I initiatives. 
We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We're committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone — regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity — knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.
Apply now!
title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)

job_description:
Xometry (NASDAQ: XMTR) powers the industries of today and tomorrow by connecting the people with big ideas to the manufacturers who can bring them to life. Xometry's digital marketplace gives manufacturers the critical resources they need to grow their business while also making it easy for buyers at Fortune 1000 companies to tap into global manufacturing capacity.
We are growing and expanding our team of Data Analysts. Therefore, we are looking for a Data Analyst to strengthen one of our data analytics Domain teams in supporting their stakeholders in data-driven decision making and business process optimization.
This position is a full-time job and involves actively creating and sharing of data related knowledge, providing BI tools to stakeholders and analytics to management.
The platform – xometry.eu
We are building the Uber-like platform for manufacturing on demand, and there is a lot of interesting work to be done. The platform (ERP/backoffice + Customers front + Partners front) is in-house developed system based on Ruby on Rails/PostgreSQL stack, Typescript/React/GraphQL frontend, Python modules and integrations with 3rd party solutions via APIs. Right now we're setting up several clones of this European platform for new regions.
Data stack is based on Snowflake / Airflow / Looker. Currently, the European data analysis team has 8 people, while the whole IT team is close to 40 people. We serve all non-US business operations with more than 200+ employees and thousands of orders monthly.
Tech stack: DWH: SnowFlake, AirFlow, Looker. Application platform: PostgreSQL, Ruby, SalesForce.
Responsibilities:
Actively participate in business development and business process optimization activities by providing data-driven insights, formulating optimization proposals, setting up experiments and evaluating results. You will work in one of the key Domains of data analytics: 1) sales/marketing, 2) order distribution, 3) operations (i.e. order fulfilment), 4) partner network management, or 5) finance. Support management in making strategic and tactical decisions based on extensive data analysis. Create and develop interactive dashboards with Looker BI platform, provide training and encourage teams and management to apply a data-driven approach to process management. Analyze product metrics to continuously improve platform service performance and company profitability. Task the data warehouse development team to obtain data needed to build dashboards/research. Participate in the development of methodology for defining key metrics, related tables and needed calculationsParticipate in AI initiatives aimed to deliver better operational results of the company. 
Successful candidate has
Technical mindset and (at least) a Bachelor's degree in Technical Science: Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or other related field. Strong knowledge of mathematics and basic knowledge of mathematical statistics. 3+ years of experience as analyst/data science preferably in b2b/b2c marketplaces Extensive hands-on experience with SQL and Python for processing and analysis (must). Proven experience developing dashboards to solve real business problems. We use Looker, but experience with Tableau, Qlik, Chartio, etc. is also relevant. Product and business sense. Understanding of the principles of unit economics, analyzing user behavior, finding insights and presenting results to management. Proficiency in English and Russian at a level not lower than B2 (must) Critical thinking ability to perceive complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them down into smaller components, schemes, types and characteristics. Demonstrated ability to work independently and be a self-starter. Ability to work effectively in a team, both in a leadership and support role. Willingness to work in a startup environment with constantly evolving goals. 
Examples of problems to be solved:
Sales strategy optimization. Our main product - Machined Parts-on-demand - is offered with different options (technologies, materials, post-processing options etc). Seems like these variants differently affect invoiced revenue and margin, claims rate, orders delays. Tasks:Formulate and constantly update optimal sales and pricing strategy and critical success factors aimed to maximize revenue and mitigate claims risks and income loss based on clustering of offered products from the historical perspective. Monitor product performance. As a product analyst, you'll monitor the performance of products over their lifecycle. You'll identify patterns and trends that indicate how well a product performs on the market, and subsequently monitor sales numbers and gather customer feedback data to gauge performance. Optimal order distribution. Each received order needs to be outsourced ASAP to the best-fit production partner. Task: Increase platform efficiency by design and implementation of optimal order distribution-to-the-Production partners strategies, balancing various efficiency criteria. Marketplace balance. Balance of Demand (customer orders requests) and Supply (availability of production partners with proper technological capabilities) are constantly changing. 
It requires us to proactively identify lacking production competences and expand the Production Partners Network. Task: Support partner network management team focusing their efforts to efficiently keep balance state.
Operational Processes Optimization: Our sales depend on customer satisfaction which depends on on-time supply production with no claims. It consequently depends on operational processes. Task: Identify bottlenecks and critical success factors in operational business processes and design a system of preventive controls to avoid customer claims/delays. 
Work conditions
Full-time job. Home office + long term contract as an Individual Entrepreneur OR relocation to Germany (Munich or Leipzig). Salary (fixed in Euros) to be discussed with each candidate. Significant bonuses or stock option program. Russian-speaking team of distributed data analysts with former employees from Yandex, Sber, Cian, Tinkoff, etc. in a large international company. Successful startup (200+ people in Europe) inside a global market leader (1000+ people overall). 
Here at Xometry we believe in diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness and providing a positive workplace for all.
Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

job_description:
Deine Aufgaben


BI als Teil der digitalen Strategie sichtbar und verständlich machenDaten-Architektur planen & Data-Warehouses erstellenDatenanalysen (Qlik Apps) planen & entwickelnKomplexe Daten unserer Kunden verstehen und sie mithilfe modernster Tools analysierenInterpretation der Ergebnisse und stetige kreative Weiterentwicklung der Analysen auf der Grundlage regelmäßiger Kundenfeedbacks


Dein Profil


Verständnis für Datenbanken und SQLErfahrung mit Business IntelligenceBegeisterung für vielfältige Daten und Affinität für die Einordnung in den wirtschaftlichen KontextErste Erfahrungen mit BI-Tools (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau) wünschenswertEine hohe Eigenmotivation und analytisches Denken


Gute Gründe für SLA


Flexible ArbeitszeitenHome-OfficeMittwochs treffen sich die Kollegen zum Fußballtraining auf unserem eigenen SLA-FußballplatzDonnerstags kannst du den Feierabend mit einer Yogastunde in unseren eigenen Räumlichkeiten einläutenUnsere Wasser- und Kaffeebar steht dir den ganzen Tag in unserer Lounge zur VerfügungMit täglich frischem Obst hältst du deinen Vitaminbedarf auf StandHansefit sowie Dienstradleasing sorgen für deine nötige BewegungSpannende, projektorientierte Aufgaben in dynamischen TeamsEin innovatives Umfeld mit Raum für eigene Ideen und persönliche EntfaltungEine vertrauensvolle, hilfsbereite und offene UnternehmenskulturKurze KommunikationswegeIndividuelle Weiterbildungsangebote


Über uns

Seit über 28 Jahren entwickeln wir Software und Hardware für die Lebensmittelindustrie auf der ganzen Welt. Und das mit ganz viel Begeisterung, Ehrgeiz und Herz. Indem wir nicht nur die Technik verstehen, sondern auch die Menschen, für die sie gemacht ist. Mit Lösungen, die so verschieden sind wie die Anforderungen unserer Kunden, denen wir täglich mit Individualität und Nähe begegnen.

Wir wollen weiterkommen, etwas bewegen, die Welt verändern und vor allem: einen Schritt voraus sein.

Wir wollen gemeinsam mehr erreichen.

Hinter dem „WIR“ stecken übrigens 80 gut ausgebildete IT-Talente, Vertriebsspezialisten, Kreativköpfe, Ideensammler, Projektmanager, Kundenberater, Technikexperten und Energiebündel.

Ganz unter dem Motto "LET'S GROW DIGITAL"  streben wir danach, die Welt mit digitalen Technologien zu bereichern.
title: Data Analyst / Data Architect (m/w/d)

job_description:
What you can expect:

As a member of our DR4 team - Operational Excellence & Manufacturing Data Analytics, you will assist us in consulting and implementing digital solutions for our clients, particularly in the aerospace industry.

Your responsibilities will include:


Assisting in the development and implementation of digital dashboardsConducting data analysis and visualizationSupporting the creation of data models and user interfacesTransferring or automating existing data evaluationsConsulting awareness sessions for clientsUndertaking general project management tasks


Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate who has successfully completed a degree in business, engineering, or a related field, and has gained initial professional experience in a consulting environment.

Additionally, you should have:


First-hand experience in front-end development (JavaScript, HTML, CSS) or back-end development (SQL, Python)Basic knowledge of data analysis, web development, or visualizationFamiliarity with Google Sheets and possibly JiraExperience with Agile/SCRUM methodologiesStrong communication skills and a team-oriented approachInitial exposure to the aerospace industry and a technical interestExcellent proficiency in both German and English, with a willingness to travel


At our company, we don't just work for our clients, we work alongside them. Effective communication, a proactive mindset, and a customer-service orientation are just as important to us as technical expertise.

Additional Information

Why join CIMPA


An international team with intercultural influenceFeelgood atmosphere: Company-wide team events, office parties at our locationsFlat hierarchy, team spirit, open door culture, vivid diversityContinuous training tailormade orientated to your personal development pathWork-life balance: Mobile working and flexible working hoursSpecial benefits, employer-sponsored company pension plan, group accident insurance also for private useSubsidy for public transportation, Business bike program and other benefits
title: Dashboard Developer / Data Analyst

job_description:
Sie sind auf der Suche nach einer neuen beruflichen Herausforderung im Bereich IT?

Die Arbeit mit Daten ist Ihre Leidenschaft?

Einer unserer namhaften Unternehmen im Raum Hannover sucht einen Data Analysten (m/w/d) im Rahmen der Direktvermittlung in Vollzeit. Klingt Spannend? Dann schicken Sie uns gerne im Vorfeld Ihren Lebenslauf und Ihre Arbeitszeugnisse zu! Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung und Sie näher kennenzulernen!

Ihre Benefits:

WeiterbildungsmöglichkeitenBetriebliche AltersvorsorgeFlexible Arbeitszeiten und Mobiles Arbeitenund vieles mehr...nd Sie näher kennenzulernen!

Ihre Aufgaben

Aufbereiten von Erkenntnissen aus der Analyse für das Treffen von UnternehmensentscheidungenDurchführen von Datenbankanalysen für alle UnternehmensbereicheAufbauen und Erstellen von Reportings mittels Business Intelligence-ToolsErstellen regelmäßiger Reportings für verschiedene UnternehmensbereicheUnterstützen bei der Weiterentwicklung eines Data-Warehouse und CRM-LösungenMitwirken bei Anfragen aus verschiedenen Fachbereichen

Das bringen Sie mit

Ein abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Mathematik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder ähnliche QualifikationenErfahrungen mit PowerBI und Data-Warehouses,Strukturierte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise, analytische Fähigkeiten und EinsatzbereitschaftErste Berufserfahrung wünschenswerterste Kenntnisse in BI-Software und Data-Visualization Tools und im Umgang mit SQL-Abfragensehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse

Nicht der passende Job für Sie? Ihre Empfehlung bedeutet uns viel!In 3 Schritten zu 500€:

 Kandidat finden: Sprechen Sie mit einem Bekannten, der an einer Mitarbeit bei uns interessiert ist.  Formular absenden: Füllen Sie das Empfehlungsformular auf unserer Homepage aus Geldprämie erhalten: Sie erhalten 250€ nach Vertragsbeginn des empfohlenen Kandidaten. Nach bestandener Probezeit werden Ihnen

weitere 250€ ausgezahlt.

Bei uns wird Ihr Berufsweg zum persönlichen Walk of Fame – wir bieten Ihnen spannende Perspektiven in den Bereichen Assistenz & Sekretariat, Marketing, Vertrieb, HR sowie Einkauf & Logistik. Jetzt auf "direkt bewerben" klicken!

Dein Kontakt

Herr Sven Schneemann

Sven.Schneemann@dis-ag.com

DIS AG

IT

Vahrenwalder Straße 238

30179 Hannover

Telefon: +49 0511/33612738

job_description:
At the Südwolle Group, we're a global family-owned company and the leaders in producing high-quality worsted yarns. Our business is built on crafting, manufacturing, and distributing exceptional wool/merino yarns to customers all around the world.

With our own production facilities located in Germany, Italy, Poland, Romania, Bulgaria, Vietnam, and China, we're committed to using cutting-edge technologies to continuously improve our yarn-making process. We're proud of our strong family values, and we believe that every member of our team is part of our flock and contributes to our success.

We're on the lookout for passionate individuals who are excited to join our flock and help us achieve our goals. If you're searching for a new challenge in an innovative company, the Südwolle Group is the perfect pasture for you to graze and grow!

Join our flock. We're currently seeking a talented

Aufgaben

Implementation of reporting and analysis requirements in close cooperation with the different departments Independent implementation and management of (sub-)projects in the business intelligence environment Continuous maintenance and monitoring of the BI system Analysis, conception and design of the BI and data warehouse structure Optimization and strategic development of the BI environment Recognition of patterns, correlations, as well as opportunities and risks Implementation of measures to ensure and improve data quality 

Profil

Successfully completed studies in (business) informatics or comparable qualification with professional experience At least 3 years of experience in requirements analysis, design and implementation of DWH / BI systems in heterogeneous system landscapes Confident handling of data integration and reporting tools (ideally with SAS DI-Studio / Visual Analytics) Very good knowledge of data management and experience with ETL processes Ideally, first experience with AI and application developments Very good analytical and conceptual skills as well as process-oriented thinking, documentation skills and agile consulting skills Enjoy working in interdisciplinary teams, ability to work under pressure and strong communication skills Fluent in English and GermanWillingness to travel (Europe/Asia) Desire to take on responsibility 

Wir bieten

 30 Vacation Days  Hybrid Working  Flexible Working Hours  a culture of informal address  Workation 30 days in Europe  Corporate Employee Discount  Training and Continuing Education  Company bicycle leasing  Company Laptop  Retirement Pension Plan  Good transport connections  Parking Lots  Free beverages  weekly fruitbasket  Employee Events  VGN company subscription  Pizza Goal  Support for childcare costs
title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)

job_description:
About Us

ATP Autoteile GmbH is one of the leading European e-commerce platforms for the automotive aftermarket. With about 350 colleagues at three locations, we are constantly developing our product range, offers and innovations for our customers.

Our company has developed from an owner-managed family business to a 100% subsidiary of the Swiss Automotive Group (SAG) in the international automotive e-commerce sector.

To take ATP to the next level we are looking for an Data Anlayst (m/f/d).

Your tasks

Drive Decision Making: Provide data-driven recommendations to the marketing and revenue management teams, aiding in strategic planning and executionOptimize Marketing Efforts: Collaborate with the team to deliver analytical projects to understand loyalty, value, lifecycle and omnichannel engagementStakeholder Communication: Regularly communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholdersEnsure Data Integrity: Regularly audit data sources and analytical processes to ensure accuracy and reliability in insights and reports

Your profile

Experience in a similar role, ideally in an ecommerce companySQL and Python proficiencyVisualization tools fundamentals, such as PowerBI or Looker StudioGood commercial acumen and understanding of how to link business objectives to measurable KPIs and project briefsAlways dig deeper into data, driven by a desire to find new insights that can help the business growExperience running analysis to answer business questions by data mining, quantitative and statistical analysis. Experience in working with large volume of customer and behavioral data a strong plus

Our offer

Exciting projects in a dynamic, transforming industry with strong growthA job based on trust, personal responsibility and feedbackMotivating, inspiring work atmosphere and a trusting working relationshipPermanent employment contractFlexible working hours & mobile officeCompany pension scheme
title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)

job_description:
At VIVERE we are uniquely positioned to disrupt the global FMCG industry.

We are a vertically integrated consumer goods company that unites all key business functions under one rooftop. Building on our proprietary and fully data-driven products and brands incubation platform we are able to develop, produce, and distribute sustainable products at record speed and of superior quality. This is a winning formula that our customers just love.

In 2018 we set out on our mission. Since then, we have launched more than 10 brands and 300 products in 16 markets across several categories including lifestyle, beauty, wellness, pet, and garden care. We sell through Amazon, our D2C platforms as well as digital 3rd-party channels. We also partner with successful influencers and well-loved brands.

As a Junior Data Analyst at VIVERE, you will shape the future of our data-driven incubation platform and help fulfill our promise to become a leading next-generation consumer goods company. The ideal candidate has an uncanny ability to create validated learnings for our business at scale. By applying your technical skills and analytical mindset as well as your intuition for consumers and for products alike, you will help define the experiences we build for thousands of customers around the world.

Reporting directly to our Data Scientist and Data Engineer, you will collaborate on a wide array of product and business-related problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Marketing, Research, Operations, Production, Sales, Finance and more.

Tasks

Work with complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches (i.e. descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics using statistics, visualizations, ML, and AI)Define, understand, and test opportunities to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations. Identify and measure the success of our efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key metricsBuild and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data productsPartner closely with cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions

Requirements

Ideally holds a BS degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or relevant other field1-2 years of experience in data analysis or relevant other field. Strong proficiency in SQLExperience in data modelling techniques. Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Looker, Qlik, Power BI, etc. Proficient in statistical analysis software such as R and Python. Strong understanding of business analyticsAnalytical SkillsCommunication SkillsTechnical ExpertiseProblem-Solving AbilityAttention to Detail

Benefits

State-of-the-art technology stack. An inspiring company culture that builds on trust. An experienced executive team that helps you become who you want to be. Flat hierarchies so you can take ownership, move fast and make things happen. A highly talented, dynamic and diverse team, with a mindset to win it all, together. A hybrid-friendly work environment. Nice perks such as free Urban Sports Club membership, free HVV ProfiTicket, regular team events or a beautiful office with a large rooftop terrace. 

Are you looking for a work environment where you can make a difference, be creative, bold, and take responsibility from day one?

Perfect! We look forward to receiving your CV!
title: Data Analyst (f/m/x)

job_description:
We are Kolibri Games - a mobile games developer from Berlin. We believe that with the best people, we can make games that players will enjoy for years to come.
Our games have defined the idle genre, and bring enjoyment to hundreds of millions of players all around the world. This is possible due to the talented people who make us who we are. ‘Kolibris’, as we call ourselves, are on a mission to continue making great games and we're looking for new talent to join our team. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.
Game Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Are you the kind of person who wonders what makes games fun? Are you the kind of person who wants to figure out not only what people do but try to understand why they do it? And can you take that knowledge and transform it into action points that are easy to understand and make the game more rewarding, and engaging to play? In this role, you will dive deep into the data by building visualizations and down-to-earth reports - applying a mixture of psychology or economics - to understand how the game works and what players do.
Responsibilities
Partner with Product Managers and Marketing Managers to identify key strategic questions, metrics, and actionable testsProvide end-user-friendly, recommendations and insights to product managers, game designers, leadership, and marketingResearch and develop cutting-edge data mining, data collection, and statistical techniques and apply them to game design, monetization, and other key business behaviors

Required Skills
3+ years of experience working as a Data AnalystPrevious experience using Data Visualization Tools such as; Looker, Tableau or similarThe ability to understand data and communicate this in a coherent manner to technical as well as non-technical team membersConfidence presenting to multiple people with the ability to clearly and concisely explain key findingsAbility to work within a fast-paced environmentStrong SQL skills in an enterprise data environment

Desirable Skills
Previous experience within a Free to Play games studioProfessional experience with at least Python, R or similarAn interest in machine learning, data science, business intelligence, and data technologies

Kolibri Games is an equal opportunity employer. We come from 40 different countries and many different backgrounds. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their age, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, physical appearance or disability.
We are an international studio, so don’t forget to send in your application in English. Although it is not mandatory, we always appreciate a cover letter stating your motivation to join us.
We look forward to hearing from you!
Your Benefits – We’re game to support you
Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment
Learning Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes
Flexible Working Hours and Home Office – We believe in a good work-life balance
Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time
Kolicard - We offer you a monthly flexible budget of 50 euros that you can use for a gym membership, transportation, shopping etc.
Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin
Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free
Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too
Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc
Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQs and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun
Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team
Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons
title: Game Data Analyst (f/m/d)

job_description:
Omikron steht für Innovation und Markterfolg. Unsere Datenlösungen sind eine zentrale Säule in der Digitalisierungsstrategie unserer Kunden – das kann komplex sein, ist aber auch unglaublich spannend und am Puls unserer Zeit. Wir wachsen stetig und suchen daher einen erfahrenen Data Consultant (m/w/d), der unser engagiertes Team auf unserer Mission mit voller Power unterstützt und eine entscheidende Rolle in der Projektabwicklung direkt beim Kunden spielt.

Aufgaben

Du sammelst und analysierst Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen und wandelst sie in aussagekräftige Insights umMithilfe von Data Visualization Tools präsentierst du die Ergebnisse auf eine klare und überzeugende ArtDu unterstützt das Team bei der Erstellung von Data-Driven-Strategien und leistest einen wichtigen Beitrag zur UnternehmensentwicklungMit deinem analytischen Blick identifizierst du Chancen und Risiken in den Daten und machst sie für das gesamte Team zugänglichDu arbeitest eng mit den Entwicklern zusammen, um datengesteuerte Lösungen zu implementieren

Qualifikation

Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare QualifikationDu besitzt fundierte Kenntnisse in der Datenanalyse und beherrschst Tools wie SQL, Python oder R souveränErfahrungen im Umgang mit Data Visualization Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI sind von VorteilDu hast ein gutes Verständnis für statistische Methoden und bringst idealerweise bereits Erfahrung mit Machine Learning mitAnalytisches Denkvermögen, Neugier und ein Auge für Details runden dein Profil ab

Benefits

Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten mit der Möglichkeit zum Home-Office, aber freuen uns genauso auf Office-Dauergäste 😉Bei uns herrscht eine Duz-Kultur und Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe, dank flacher Hierarchien und kurzer EntscheidungswegeSpaß und Teamgeist kommen nicht zu kurz – zahlreiche Mitarbeiterevents wie Paintball, Karaoke, Brettspielabende, Hochseilgartenklettern, Wanderausflüge uvm. sorgen für AbwechslungDu wirst Teil eines motivierten und dynamischen Projektteams, auf das du dich verlassen kannstModerne Tools unterstützen dich dabei, deine Ziele zu erreichen

Bereichere unser Team und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der Digitalisierung! Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d).
title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Mach Daten lebendig!

job_description:
Positive Thinking Company ist Teil unseres weltweiten Ökosystems "Collaboration betters the world". Unsere 6 Gründungspartner Positive Thinking Company, Steep, Versett, Alispharm, Otofacto & OneAston helfen dabei das Unternehmenswachstum unserer Kund:innen durch Strategie, Technologie und Design zu verwirklichen!

Wir suchen dein Talent und deine Leidenschaft zur Verstärkung unserer Data & Analytics Expert:innen. Schließ dich uns an, entfalte Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecke unsere Community mit Deiner Begeisterung und deinen Ideen an. Was uns wichtig ist? Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung. Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend:

Aufgaben

Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für KundenZusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisierenSelf-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die DatenvorverarbeitungKonsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen

Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren StudienrichtungCa. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data AnalyticsTechnologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder YellowfinErfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von VorteilVerhandlungssichere Deutsch- und EnglischkenntnisseReisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region

Benefits

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: Unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

title: Data Analyst (M/W/D)

job_description:
Deine Aufgaben
InnoNature ist ein wachsendes Unternehmen im Herzen Hamburgs im Bereich Supplements, Superfoods und Naturkosmetik.
Unsere Vision ist es, allen Frauen ein gesundes Leben zu ermöglichen. Wir sind ein junges, passioniertes Team, das für das Thema ganzheitliche Gesundheit brennt und voll und ganz hinter der Qualität unserer natürlichen Produkte steht.
Komm an Board und werde Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte.
Um unser Wachstum weiter voranzutreiben, suchen wir einen engagierten Data Analysten, der uns bei der Analyse und Auswertung unserer Daten unterstützt.
Deine Aufgaben:
Sammeln, analysieren und interpretieren von Daten aus verschiedenen internen und externen Quellen, um Erkenntnisse und Handlungsempfehlungen für das Management abzuleiten.Identifizierung von Trends, Mustern und Abweichungen in den Daten, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen und Chancen für das Unternehmen aufzuzeigen.Erstellung von Dashboards, Berichten und Präsentationen zur Visualisierung und Kommunikation der Datenanalysen.Entwicklung und Implementierung von statistischen Modellen und Algorithmen zur Vorhersage von Geschäftsergebnissen und zur Optimierung von Prozessen.Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen, um datengesteuerte Lösungen und Strategien zu entwickeln und umzusetzen.Überwachung und Bewertung der Datenqualität sowie Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Maßnahmen zur Datenbereinigung und -verbesserung.Aufbau eines umfassenden Verständnisses für unsere Kund*innen und Märkte durch die Analyse von Kundendaten und Markttrends.Entwicklung von ETL-Prozessen zum Extrahieren, Transformieren und Laden von Daten aus verschiedenen Datenquellen (z. B. Shopify, Google Analytics) in das Data WarehouseKonzeption, Implementierung, und Dokumentation von Datenmodellen in DBT 

Wen wir suchen 
Abgeschlossenes Studium in den Bereichen Datenanalyse, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse und -auswertung, in einem E-Commerce- oder technologieorientierten Unternehmen.Sicherer Umgang mit Datenanalyse-Tools wie SQL, Python, R oder vergleichbaren Tools.Erfahrung in Design und Implementierung von Data Warehouse Architekturen. Idealerweise mit BigQuery und DBTErfahrung mit Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau, Power BI oder ähnlichen Tools.Kenntnisse in statistischer Analyse und Modellierung.Hohe analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich zu kommunizieren.Teamorientierte Arbeitsweise und die Fähigkeit, effektiv mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern zusammenzuarbeiten.Hohe Eigenmotivation und die Fähigkeit, selbständig Projekte voranzutreiben.

Was wir Dir bieten
Mitarbeit in einem jungen und sympathischen Startup im Bereich Ernährung und Lifestyle.Perfekte Möglichkeit, Verantwortung und Eigeninitiative zu übernehmen.Die Chance eigene Ideen in Deinen Bereichen umzusetzen und InnoNature voran zu bringen.Flache Hierarchien mit einem harmonischen Umgang und einer Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe.Modernes Büro an einem tollen Standort in Hamburg. Mit dabei sind: Macbook, voll ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz, 3x pro Woche vollwertiges Mittagessen, gekocht von unserer InnoKitchen, Obst und Getränke-Flatrate, 1x pro Monat kostenlose Massage, InnoNature Produkt-Flatrate.Hybrides Arbeitsmodell (z.B. montags und freitags Homeoffice Option).

Du hast Interesse? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung über unsere Karriereseite.
Über uns
Wir sind ein aufstrebendes Startup aus Hamburg, 
welches seinen Fokus auf natürliche und ganzheitliche Nahrungsergänzungsmittel legt.
Du wünscht Dir einen Job, den Du nicht nur als Mittel zum Zweck, sondern auch als Herzensprojekt betrachten kannst?
Ist das Thema Ganzheitlichkeit kein Fremdwort für Dich? Reizt Dich eine moderne Arbeitsatmosphäre? Dann freuen wir uns sehr, Dich kennenzulernen!
InnoNature ist ein kleines Unternehmen, das aus einer ganz persönlichen Leidenschaft entstand 
und deshalb auch mit besonders viel Herz und Passion geführt wird.
Wir sind 100% überzeugt von dem, was wir tun und möchten unsere ganzheitliche Botschaft verbreiten.
Wir legen viel Wert auf die Meinung jeder einzelnen Person und sind immer offen für neue Ideen und Erfahrungen.
Neben einem einzigartigen Team, in dem Dein Input nicht nur geschätzt sondern auch erwünscht ist, bieten wir Dir Raum,
Dich aktiv an der Entwicklung unseres Unternehmens zu beteiligen. Alles ist möglich!
title: Data Analyst*in (m/w/d)

job_description:
Die Talentschmiede fördert als branchenübergreifende IT-Unternehmensberatung den Einsatz von Absolventen und Young Professionals. Wir bieten unseren Kunden Projektteams mit jungen, talentierten und hoch motivierten Mitarbeitern, die wir mittels unseres innovativen Ausbildungs- und Betreuungskonzeptes kontinuierlich fortbilden.
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Berlin einen Young Professional Client Data Analyst (m/w/d), der gerne im Bereich Datenanalyse arbeitet und sich sowohl durch tiefe als auch breite Kompetenz in diesem Wissensbereich auszeichnen möchte.
Ihre Aufgaben
Sie sind für die Analyse von Datenstrukturen zahlreicher Kundendatenbanken sowie das Design der Datenbankarchitektur verantwortlich.Sie validieren Datenquellen, um die Daten hinsichtlich der Vollständigkeit, Qualität und Konsistenz beurteilen zu können.Sie verantworten die Normalisierung von Daten, um eine Integration und Automatisierung von Datenflüssen zu ermöglichen.Sie bilden Datensätze aus verschiedenen Datenquellen ab und sind für die Automatisierung von Datenerfassungen zuständig.Sie initiieren und implementieren Veränderungen technischer und operativer Prozesse zur Reduzierung von Datenproblemen.Sie entwickeln Lösungspläne und -prozesse für Key Data Challenges und das zugehörige Reporting.Sie durchlaufen ein individuelles Weiterbildungsprogramm und entwickeln sich zum zertifizierten Data Analyst weiter.
Fachliche Anforderungen
Abgeschlossenes Studium in einem der folgenden Studiengänge: Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften mit IT-Schwerpunkt, Mathematik, Physik oder Ingenieurdisziplinen oder eine vergleichbare Berufserfahrung, z. B. als Fachinformatiker/-in mit hervorragendem PrüfungsabschlussBisherige berufliche Erfahrung im Bereich der Datenanalyse oderBewährte Erfahrung als Praktikant oder Werkstudent im Bereich Informationstechnologie.Sie besitzen praktische Kenntnisse in der Datenbankentwicklung (z.B. Oracle, SQL).Grundverständnis für IT-Architektur, Infrastrukturmanagement und Web-Technologien.
Ihr Profil
Analytisches Denkvermögen, gedankliche Flexibilität und ProblemlösungsfähigkeitSelbstständiger, methodischer Arbeitsstil und EigeninitiativePraxisorientierte Arbeitsweise, technische Begeisterung und ZielorientierungTeamfähigkeit und Kundenorientierung
Als Arbeitgeber Bieten Wir
Individuelles Einarbeitungsprogramm – Persönlich auf Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse zugeschnitten und mit Erfolgsgarantie für die Zertifizierung in dem gewählten Karrierepfad.Fortbildungs- und Betreuungskonzept – Ein innovatives und kontinuierliches Trainingsangebot mit allem, was E-Learning-, Classroom- und Onsite-Trainings namhafter Anbieter und Hersteller zu bieten haben.Mentoring und Coaching – Inklusive regelmäßiger Feedback- und Zielvereinbarungsgespräche mit dem Management und der Gewissheit, jederzeit ein Mensch mit Persönlichkeit zu sein und keine Personalnummer in einem Konzern.Junges, dynamisches und internationales Team mit flachen Hierarchien – Gegenseitige Hilfsbereitschaft und echte Freundschaften.Regelmäßige Teamevents –Gemeinsame Mittagessen, Theaterbesuche, Sommerfeiern, damit neben der Arbeit auch der gemeinsame Spaß nicht zu kurz kommt.Teamorientiertes Arbeiten mit herausfordernden und abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben – Aufgaben, die nicht nur fördern, sondern auch fordern, um das Beste aus einem herauszuholen.Spannende Karriereperspektiven – Von der Weiterentwicklung zum Unternehmensberater oder der Internalisierung bis hin zur weitergehenden Spezialisierung innerhalb der Organisation unserer Kunden.Unbefristete Festanstellung – Mit marktgerechten Gehältern und allen den vorgenannten Vorteilen!
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen und bitten Sie um Zusendung an jobs@talentschmiede.com . Bitte vergessen Sie nicht, uns Ihre Gehaltsvorstellung und den möglichen Eintrittstermin mitzuteilen.
Für telefonische Rückfragen steht Ihnen gerne Hannah Frank unter +49 69 970 979 58 zur Verfügung. Für weitere Informationen besuchen Sie uns doch auf Talentschmiede.com .

Du wirst nicht nur von unserer vielfältigen Community unterstützt, sondern kannst auch von regelmäßigem Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten profitieren. Bei uns wird dein persönliches und berufliches Wachstum gefördert.

Du wirst mit modernsten Technologien arbeiten und dabei die Chance haben, unsere Anwendungen auf ein neues Level zu bringen. Deine Ideen und Begeisterung sind bei uns gefragt und können einen echten Einfluss auf die Zukunft der Industrie haben.

Wenn du bereit bist, in einem hochmotivierten Team zu arbeiten und gemeinsam mit uns die Grenzen des Machbaren zu verschieben, dann bewirb dich jetzt als Data Analyst bei der CBTW Gruppe. Werde Teil unseres erfolgreichen Teams und gestalte die Zukunft der Brand PTC mit.

Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für KundenZusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisierenSelf-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die DatenvorverarbeitungKonsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen

realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung

Ca. 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data AnalyticsVerhandlungssichere Deutsch (C1)- und EnglischkenntnisseReisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region

Benefits

Branchen.

immer dazu.

herausfordernd.

Feiertage des Bundeslandes Baden-Württemberg.

inspirieren uns gegenseitig mit neuen Ideen.

Weihnachtsfeiern.

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran - Wir freuen uns darauf Dich kennenzulernen!
title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)

job_description:
PLAION - Munich

PLAION (formerly known as Koch Media) is an international media company with more than 2000 employees worldwide. As a leading and independent producer and marketer of digital entertainment products in Europe, the USA, Australia and Japan, our business areas include the production of films and games, the purchase and sale of film license rights, the distribution of digital media products and games publishing under the Deep Silver, Prime Matter and Ravenscourt game labels.

For our GamesLab Team we are actively seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst (m/f/d).

PLAION's GamesLab operates to provide reliable insights that can be trusted and worked on, both on User Research and Data Science/Analytics topics.

Our aim is to collaborate with each team in a meaningful way, to add value to their projects and go together towards a common goal: create the best games possible.

To do so, the GamesLab is structured around two teams of deeply involved experts, each conducting projects in the Data or User Research field.

Combining these skillsets into one team allows us to better understand our player's behaviour, needs and expectations, enabling a relevant teamwork with our 10+ Game Studios.

Fuelled with passion, aiming for impact - this is the GamesLab.

Do you thrive to make a difference? Then jump onboard and join our crew!

Your Tasks

Main goals:

Communicate proficiently, be curious and listen in order to identify valuable data use cases. Then design, plan and develop your analytics projects and share insights following GamesLab's quality standards/procedures and Data Visualisation best practicesCollarborate with our User Research Team to ensure reliable, clear and impactful data analysis that benefits the Game Studios and internal teamsHelp the team address new promising use cases and use new tools/methodologies to guaranty continuous improvement and push innovation forward


Your responsibilites:

Query and analyse high volumes of data using an efficient, reliable and commented approach (SQL, R, Python is a plus)Choose and define appropriate methodologies, metrics and visualisations to accurately understand our players' behaviour, needs and/or expectationsDesign and develop Dashboards aiming to be clear and impactful using BI Tools (Power BI) or open source libraries (R/Python)Help Production Teams in the data collection process to guarantee completeness and reliability of our game's dataSupport the Development Teams through all the stages of their games' lifecycle by providing Prelaunch (tests, QA, alpha, beta, early access) and Postlaunch (Premium and LiveOps games) data analysisEnsure relevant integration of both qualitative and quantitative data in User Research/Playtest reportsDesign new tools and help build new methodologies to steer GamesLab's innovation


Your Profile

Curious and committed, you have a strong ability to adapt and learn. You are rigorous, have good interpersonal skills and a strong team spirit3+ years of experience in analytics and/or data management related role (in the Gaming Industry is a strong plus)Advanced degrees in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Systems Management, AI/Machine Learning/Deep Learning, a related discipline, or comparable work experiencesEffective communication skills, including presenting and sharing information with audiences across a wide array of technical expertise, culture and seniorityExperience developing production-quality data products in SQL and R (Python is a plus)Strong technical skills in BI/visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or open source libraries (R/Python)Experience working with cloud and/or on premise databases, handling both structured and unstructured data (Google BigQuery, MongoDB, MySQL, Redshift…)Passion for both video games and analytics


What we offer

Employment in one of the most exciting industries in the world: the film and games industryPartnership-oriented working atmosphere in a modern and broad-based media companyWide range of training and development opportunities as part of our PLAION AcademyCompany benefits such as employee events, fitness cooperation with Urban Sports, bicycle leasing, flexible working hours, 30 days vacation, company pension plan, free drinks, fresh fruit, etc.Opportunity to share your passion for movies and games with colleagues


Do you want to be part of our success story? We look forward to receiving your application!

The more comprehensive your documents are to us, the better we can get a picture of you. You should upload at least one cover letter and your CV. Please prefer to use our online application form. If you have any further questions, please send an e-mail to jobs@plaion.com.

PLAION GmbH - Lochhamer Str. 9 - 82152 Planegg - www.plaion.de

title: Data Analyst (M/W/D)

job_description:
Your tasks
 You will design, develop and implement report templates (dashboard) for daily, monthly and annual reports according to federal requirements and create ad hoc reports on demand  You will visualize required process and performance metrics in the site definition, site establishment/expansion, and site operations phases  You create in coordination with colleagues from the finance area meaningful reports, especially on the status of disbursement, claim and receipt of funds from the federal government, as well as the approved additional costs  You are responsible for monitoring the reporting and reporting obligations of the operators to the BMDV and develop recommendations for action in case of anomalies  You prepare the regular coordination meetings with the BMDV and external service providers, prepare  You maintain and optimize the reporting system and the associated reporting tools and advise the users*innen 
Your profile
 You have a degree in economics with a quantitative orientation (alternatively also Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or Business Informatics) or a comparable education.  You already have initial work experience as a data analyst or business analyst  You are adept at working with databases and data warehouse systems (Cognos)  You are interested in expanding your knowledge and experience in reporting as well as process optimization and automation  You have a strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills as well as an independent and structured working style 
What we offer
 Broad range of qualifications for professional and personal development  Hybrid work  Interdisciplinary, motivated and dynamic team that shapes progress  Attractive remuneration as well as extensive social benefits from job ticket to a subsidy for lunch to the company pension scheme. 
Interested?
We look forward to receiving your application documents without photo and indicating the earliest possible start date and your salary expectations.
We look forward to receiving your meaningful application documents, stating the earliest possible starting date and the expected end of your studies. Please send us your documents exclusively as a PDF file with a maximum total size of 3 MB. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our privacy policy for applications.
Applicants* with a severe disability (d/m/w) will be given preference in case of equal suitability.
Your contact person
Silvia Barknecht - 030/74077-8214 - karriere@toll-collect.de
Toll Collect GmbH - Human Resources Management - Linkstraße 4, 10785 Berlin
title: Data Analyst*in / Reporting Officer*in Civil Engineering (d/m/w)

job_description:
Are you an experienced data analyst looking for a new challenge? A global company in the semiconductor industry is looking for someone to join their dynamic team! As part of the Human Capital Analytics organization, you will have the opportunity to manage all aspects of the employee experience. In this role, you will be responsible for building strong compensation and performance management solutions for the organization and working in close partnership with the Human Capital teams company-wide.
Your tasks will include managing the development, implementation, and administration of the company's Compensation and Performance Management, providing recommendations to the Human Capital Leadership Team, maintaining job and salary structures in the HRIS system, and conducting ad-hoc compensation analysis by compiling, interpreting, and presenting data to key stakeholders. Additionally, you will be responsible for contributing to new initiatives to optimize Human Capital programs and technology solutions and providing assistance and advice to Human Capital management and operation teams on all relevant aspects of global compensation and related processes.
If you are a results-driven candidate with strong analytical and data analysis/interpretation skills, an excellent command of English, and the ability to work effectively with a distributed team, we want you to join our team. We are looking for someone who is flexible, willing to learn, and capable of handling company personal data with a high degree of confidentiality.
Apply now for the Data Analyst (m/f/d) position and become a steward of the company's culture and core values while continuously improving your skills and abilities.
title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)

job_description:
IDS GmbH - Analysis and Reporting Services (IDS) unlocks the value of data for the global investment industry: We validate, refine, and link data from a wide variety of sources and make it available for mission-critical processes along all investment strategies and products quickly, worldwide, and at any time. Fund management companies, insurance companies, banks and pension funds can use IDS to access a flexibly scalable data platform as well as all necessary analyses and reports in the desired format. As a 100% subsidiary of Allianz SE, IDS has stood for stability, reliability and certified security in the handling of its customers' data since 2001.
27227 | Asset & Investment Management | Professional | IDS | Full-Time | Permanent
 JOB PURPOSE/ROLE 
Join us as Data Analyst for ETL processes and become part of a team of motivated experts. At IDS GmbH we combine Finance and IT know-how to get maximum value out of the data for our clients. Our team is responsible for providing high-quality data to downstream services, supporting the reporting and decision-making process of one of the world’s leading financial institutions. In this role you will gain deep insights into the underlying data model of a major financial company, from a technical as well as a business perspective.
Key Responsibilities

 Supervise data flows and proper processing within our services “Data Sourcing” and “Data Exports” which are responsible for in- and outbound file delivery  Ensure smooth data processing and the achievement of agreed data quality standards in close cooperation with the team, developers and external providers  Resolve service disruptions, e.g. file transfer issues, and provide a Root Cause Analysis  Handle complex client inquiries, e.g. analyzing data flows and validating results  Proactively identify process improvements and work with experts from other departments to ensure the continuous improvement of our services  Support the definition of KPIs for the service delivery to our clients  Participate in projects to implement new client requirements like the onboarding of new data sources 

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

 University degree in (Business) Informatics, computer science and/or equivalent working experience in IT  Experience in working with ETL tools, especially Informatica PowerCenter, is an advantage  High data affinity and experience in data analysis, preferably with relational databases (SQL, PL/SQL)  Basic understanding of shell scripts, Python and Unix is an advantage  High responsibility, service attitude and process-oriented thinking  Basic knowledge of financial data is an advantage  Experience in working with or management of service providers is an advantage  Team player mentality, creativity and problem-solving mentality  Fluent in English, German is an advantage 

What We Offer

 Benefit from flexible working hours, a home office arrangement and 30 vacation days per year  With us, you can expect an intercultural environment with flat hierarchies, a familiar working atmosphere as well as independent work in dedicated teams  Become part of a company with start-up spirit that combines the advantages of the Allianz Group  Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities and shape your individual career path  Benefit, among other things, from annual bonus payments, additional benefits, health initiatives, employee restaurant and a company pension plan 

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
title: Data Analyst ETL Processes (m/f/d)

job_description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and translating web and business data into actionable insights. Your primary focus will be to report on company activities, understand user behavior, and assist our marketing and operations teams. This role is critical in guiding our business decisions and improving customer satisfaction.

This is a technical role requiring extensive use of SQL to query databases and Excel, while also requiring you to liaise with stakeholders of all levels throughout the business.

You will be directly involved in the day-to-day of the business operations; from gathering requirements from stakeholders to giving recommendations to the management team. You will get exposure to both BI and MI, creating reports across multiple platforms.

Note that this role is available for candidates based in the UK or EU, timezone between UTC+0 - UTC+1. If you are based in the UK and need a work visa we are unable to provide it. Applicants who don't fit this requirement won't be considered for the role. 

Key Responsibilities

Web Data Analysis: Analyse web traffic data using tools such as Google Analytics, Innertrends, or similar platforms. Identify trends, patterns, and user behavior to provide valuable insights to the marketing and product teams. Business Data Analysis: Analyse business data using SQL and Excel, to report on revenues, and customer churn, and provide data to build forecasting models. Reporting and Dashboards: Create and maintain dashboards and reports that visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer acquisition, conversion rates, and user engagement. A/B Testing: Collaborate with the marketing team to analyze A/B tests to optimize website elements, including landing pages, marketing emails, and forms. Other Experimentation: Collaborate with the operations and customer success teams to devise valid experiments intended to improve processes, efficiency, and commercial outcomes. Process Analysis: Assist the operations team to create and automate processes related to business initiativesStakeholder Interaction: Liaise with stakeholders on a frequent basis to gather requirements, and translate the business context to actionable tasks. Data-driven Recommendations: Advise stakeholders by providing actionable recommendations whilst also managing expectations. 

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Business Analytics, or Mathematics. 2-3 years of experience as a Data Analyst. Proficiency in PostgreSQL (or similar) and Excel. Python is a plus. Experience with data visualization tools. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights. Excellent communication skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders. Detail-oriented and highly organized. Able to self-manage priorities.
title: Data Analyst

job_description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our Royalty Data Analytics team in Berlin. As a Data Analyst, you will collaborate with various departments within the Company, to facilitate informed decision-making through high-quality data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. You will also be responsible for delivering sophisticated data modelling and self-service reporting solutions that can improve how we operate and solve business issues.

Your Tasks
Manage and process big data volumes, extracting and transforming data from centralized data warehouses and multiple organizational databases to prepare royalty analyses and KPIs.Ensure the accurate and high-quality analysis, design, and presentation of data to facilitate improved decision-making for businesses and organizations.Develop self-service reporting solutions as well as answer ad-hoc queries.Collaborate with developers, engineers and management leaders to identify and propose process improvements, system modifications and develop data governance strategies. Utilize data visualization reporting to support decision-making, crafting compelling dashboards for various stakeholders.Maintain and continually improve automated tools, databases, and dashboards.
Your Skillset
Degree in business information systems, business informatics, computer science, data science, information technology, or related field.Experience in the field of data analytics; music or media industry experience is preferred.Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Looker or Data Studio, including writing custom SQL queries. Knowledge of Python is an added advantage.Experience with JIRA service desk and Confluence is preferred.Fluent in English, with German skills being a plus.
Your Mindset
Ability to learn and understand the data landscape in new databases and applications.Keen interest in maintaining data quality by considering data governance guidelines.Meticulous and analytical work style, with a focus on results, organization, and a deep passion for deriving business-enhancing insights from data.Capability to independently plan and execute your own projects, displaying a proactive and self-directed approach when tackling new subjects.
What We Offer
A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, an annual Headspace membership, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, discounts for Bertelsmann employees etc.Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann UniversityLong-term career opportunities for all employees.A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.
This Is Us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Berlin, BE, DE, 10117
